snippet: Proposals by the Republican majority on the Federal Election Commission would provide further aid to politicians and operatives who run roughshod over campaign laws.
abstract: Editorial warns that Republican members of Federal Election Commission are poised to push through vote that would significantly diminish existing campaign regulations; argues that move, which takes advantage of temporary vacancy, amounts to naked subversion.
lead_paragraph: Proposals by the Republican majority on the Federal Election Commission would provide further aid to politicians and operatives who run roughshod over campaign laws.
